newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China's Qinghua mulls 50 mln A share offer.
newsitem.headline: China's Qinghua mulls 50 mln A share offer.

text.p: Beijing-based Qinghua Tongfang Co Ltd plans to offer up to 50 million A shares with CITIC Securities Co Ltd the main underwriter, a company spokesman said on Friday.

The company, a software developer that also makes computers, has applied to the China Securities Regulatory Commission for approval but has not yet decided whether the shares would be listed in Shenzhen or Shanghai, the spokesman told China Securities Bulletin, a Hong Kong-based publication.
He said the firm planned to use the proceeds to expand its software prodution and to launch a new project to produce an electronic anti-burglary system.
The company forecast net profits of 80 million yuan for 1997, compared with about 40 million yuan estimated for 1996, the official said.
Earnings this year are expected to be boosted by efforts to increase production and sales, he said.
Tongfang, located in China's prestigious Qinghua University, has about 100 million outstanding shares, the official said.
State-owned Qinghua University Enterprise Group will be one of Tongfang's main shareholders, he added but declined to give more details.
